00020 using namespace Omiscid;

00022 namespace Omiscid {

00029 class AccumulatorConnectorListener : public ConnectorListener
00030 {
00031 public:
00032     /* @brief constructor */
00033     AccumulatorConnectorListener();
00034     /* @brief destructor */
00035     virtual ~AccumulatorConnectorListener();
00036
00037     /* @brief callback function to receive data */
00038     virtual void MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg);
00039
00040 private:
00041     Mutex Locker;
00043     float Accu;
00044 };
00045
00046 } // namespace Omiscid

00049     /* @brief constructor */
00050 AccumulatorConnectorListener::AccumulatorConnectorListener()
00051 {
00052     // set initial value to the Accu
00053     Accu = 0.0f;
00054 }
00055
00056     /* @brief destructor */
00057 AccumulatorConnectorListener::~AccumulatorConnectorListener()
00058 {
00059 }
00060
00061     /* @brief callback function to receive data */
00062 void AccumulatorConnectorListener::MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg)
00063 {
00064     // Error management
00065     bool IsWrong = true;        // by default, the command is wrong
00066     SimpleString ErrorMessage = "Bad command.";
00067
00068     // Used to read operand ?
00069     float fRightOperand = 0.0f;
00070
00071     // A pointer to the command line and to the begining of the usufull data
00072     char * Command;
00073     int  StartUsefullInfo;
00074
00075     // parse string to understand command
00076     // Start lock myself using my mutex (needed if multiple clients)
00077     Locker.EnterMutex();
00078
00079     // Get the pointer to the data
00080     Command = Msg.GetBuffer();
00081
00082     // skip data while there are spaces...
00083     for( StartUsefullInfo = 0; Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\0'; StartUsefullInfo++ )
00084     {
00085         if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] != ' ' &&  Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\t' &&
00086              Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\r' && Command[StartUsefullInfo] != '\n' )
00087         {
00088             break;
00089         }
00090     }
00091
00092     // Is it a legal command ?
00093     if ( Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '-' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '+' ||
00094             Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '/' || Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '*' ||
00095             Command[StartUsefullInfo] == '=' )
00096     {
00097         // look for a float like 3.14 and then for
00098         if ( sscanf( &Command[StartUsefullInfo+1], "%f", &fRightOperand ) == 1 )
00099         {
00100             IsWrong = false;
00101         }
00102         // else IsWrong == true;
00103
00104         // If it is ok,
00105         if ( IsWrong == false )
00106         {
00107             // run the command
00108             switch( Command[StartUsefullInfo] )
00109             {
00110                 case '-':
00111                     // Compute new value
00112                     Accu -= fRightOperand;
00113                     break;
00114
00115                 case '+':
00116                     // Compute new value
00117                     Accu += fRightOperand;
00118                     break;
00119
00120                 case '*':
00121                     // Compute new value
00122                     Accu *= fRightOperand;
00123                     break;
00124
00125                 case '/':
00126                     if ( fRightOperand == 0.0f )
00127                     {
00128                         // we can not divide by 0
00129                         IsWrong = true;
00130                     }
00131                     else
00132                     {
00133                         // Compute new value
00134                         Accu /= fRightOperand;
00135                     }
00136                     break;
00137
00138                 default:         // here, Command[0] == '='
00139                     Accu = fRightOperand;
00140                     break;
00141             }
00142         }
00143     }
00144     if ( IsWrong == false )
00145     {
00146         // export the new Accu value, so the clients will receive notification
00147         TheService.SetVariableValue("Accu", Accu);
00148     }
00149     else
00150     {
00151         // Discard value and send back to the rigth "person" an error message in safe mode (TCP)
00152         TheService.SendReplyToMessage( (char*)ErrorMessage.GetStr(), (int)ErrorMessage.GetLength(), Msg, false );
00153     }
00154
00155     // Unlock myself
00156     Locker.LeaveMutex();
00157 }
00158

00161 /* @brief main program entry for the Accumulator. No need to give parameter */
00162 int main(int argc, char*argv[] )
00163 {
00164     // TrackMemoryLeaks TML;
00165
00166     // Instanciate a Connector listener (must *not* be destroyed before it has
00167     // been removed for the connector or until the service is destroyed).
00168     AccumulatorConnectorListener MyCommandsListener;
00169
00170     // Ask to the service factory to create a Service. The service is not
00171     // register yet. We do not provide the service class, the default value 'Service'
00172     // will be used
00173     Service * pAccuServer = ServiceFactory.Create( "Accumulator" );
00174
00175     // If something tricky occurred, exit
00176     if ( pAccuServer == NULL )
00177     {
00178         fprintf( stderr, "Could not register the Accumulator service.\n" );
00179
00180         // Exit the thread
00181         return -1;
00182     }
00183
00184     for (int i = 0 ; i < 1400 ; i++)
00185     {
00186        SimpleString var = "v";
00187        var += i;
00188        pAccuServer->AddVariable(var, "bla", "bla", ReadWriteAccess);
00189        pAccuServer->SetVariableValue(var, "a");
00190      }
00191
00192     // Just add a Variable of ReadAccess (read only) that can not be modifies by other services.
00193     // Set its value to the starting value
00194     pAccuServer->AddVariable( "Accu", "float", "Accumulator value", ReadWriteAccess );
00195     pAccuServer->SetVariableValue( "Accu", 0.0f );
00196
00197     // Add a Connector to receive and send messages (AnInOutput) and set my callback
00198     // object to receive notification of messages
00199     pAccuServer->AddConnector( "Commands", "Input for commands. output of errors.", AnInOutput );
00200     pAccuServer->AddConnectorListener( "Commands", &MyCommandsListener );
00201
00202     // register the service and launch everything
00203     pAccuServer->Start();
00204
00205     // Trace
00206     fprintf( stderr, "Accumulator service started.\n" );
00207
00208     // Create an Event and wait for it. As no one will signal it, we will
00209     // stay forever stuck here.
00210     Event Forever;
00211     Forever.Wait();
00212
00213     // exit
00214     return 0;
00215 }
